str2: A primary particle; properly, indicative of affirmation or concession; usually followed by a contrasted clause with de.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To shake off. From apo and tinasso; to brush off.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Properly: a wild beast, hence: any animal; met: a brute. Diminutive from the same as thera; a dangerous animal.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.
